{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45929].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the JIRA REST API does not support creating projects using a Shared Configuration. The only way to do this is through the JIRA Project Creation UI.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow creating projects with Shared Configuration through REST API.
h3. Workaround
 # Refer to [Create new Project via REST based on existing Project|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Create-new-Project-via-REST-based-on-existing-Project/qaq-p/527104]
 # JIRA CLI Plugin can also create projects via scripting, but with more flexibility of setting the schemes: [https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JCLI/Reference#Reference-createProject]
 # Use [/rest/api/2/project|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.6.1/#api/2/project-createProject] and manually specify the scheme IDs and/or projectTemplateKey (untested)
fields.summary: Allow creating projects with Shared Configuration using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Actual Problem:

If you disable thumbnail generation system wide (*Administration > System > Attachments*), when attaching an image to JIRA the image will not be displayed as JIRA adds the following to the comment:
{code}!imagename.jpg|thumbnail!{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Disable Thumbnails
# Add an image by copying and pasting it or using the _Attachment > Browse_ option in the Text Editor:
!Screen Shot 2015-10-22 at 14.06.09.png!
# The comment will not display the image:
!Screen Shot 2015-10-22 at 14.06.25.png!

h3. Expected Behavior:

* Display the image without adding a flag that will not work as it's disable system-wide
_OR_
* Display the image as an attachment link instead.

h3. Workaround:

# Attach the image and then click on the Attachment option again to add the image. This will include the image without the thumbnail flag.
# Manually remove the {{|thumbnail}} from the comment.
# Manually use attachment links.
fields.summary: Remove thumbnail flag when its disabled system-wide

fields.description:
XML restore or backup can fail silently. This has been verified to happen in cases with large activeobjects.xml data which is part of the backup archive.

We need to catch this and throw an error. 

Workaround so far has been to increase the amount of heap allocated to the JVM.
fields.summary: JIRA XML restore or backup fails silently

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45917].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As part of JIRA Service Desk now, JIRA is storing the incoming mails in the database (done by the JEPP). Those are stored inside the *AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK* table.

JIRA is, sometimes, silently failing to import or export the active objects part of the backup.

\\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA;
# Import the backup linked on the private comments.
# JIRA will stop importing once it reaches 90%. Restart JIRA.
# Navigate to *Administration » System » Plugin Data Storage* and verify what has been imported.

\\
h3. Expected Results
All entries in the active objects table would have been imported/exported.

\\
h3. Actual Results
* *Exporting:* JIRA creates the backup normally, but upon inspecting the {{activeobjects.xml}} file (using the grep below) not all entries are in the file.
* *Importing:* JIRA fails to import the data once it reaches 90%, but after restarting JIRA it seems to have imported correctly. Inspecting the *Plugin Data Storage* shows most tables as empty, and inspecting the {{activeobjects}} file shows all data.

The following errors might be found in the Jira logs:
The following errors might be seen in the logs:
{code}
2020-11-06 19:19:32,337-0500 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR anonymous 528x1190x1 409hrc XX.XX.XX.XXX /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.hugeCapacity(AbstractStringBuilder.java:161)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.newCapacity(AbstractStringBuilder.java:155)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.ensureCapacityInternal(AbstractStringBuilder.java:125)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(AbstractStringBuilder.java:448)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:136)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:76)
{code}

{code}
[2020-08-20 01:00:16,045-0400 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR test 1002x937x1 1fztp06 XXXXXXXXX /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError020-08-20 01:00:16,045-0400 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR test 1002x937x1 test XXXXXX /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.OutOfMemoryErrorjava.lang.OutOfMemoryError)
{code}

{code}
2019-03-18 07:36:01,857 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR test 381x754x1 1py7sdr XXXXXXXX /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
{code}

(!) This seems to be happening because JIRA runs out of memory due to import, but fails to log any errors or warnings.

\\
h3. Notes
To verify the data inside the activeobjects.xml backup, run:
{code}
grep -E  "data tableName=|<row>" activeobjects.xml | uniq -c
{code}
This will show how many rows were exported for each table. For example, when JIRA failed to export correctly, this was shown:
{noformat}
      1   <data tableName="AO_21D670_WHITELIST_RULES">
      3     <row>
      1   <data tableName="AO_2C4E5C_MAILCHANNEL">
      1     <row>
      1   <data tableName="AO_2C4E5C_MAILCONNECTION">
      1     <row>
      1   <data tableName="AO_2C4E5C_MAILGLOBALHANDLER">
      1   <data tableName="AO_2C4E5C_MAILHANDLER">
      5     <row>
      1   <data tableName="AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEM">
   3625     <row>
      1   <data tableName="AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMAUDIT">
   3625     <row>
      1   <data tableName="AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK">
    691     <row>
{noformat}
It is possible to see what tables were (supposed to be) exported to the backup with:
{noformat}
grep "table name=" activeobjects.xml
{noformat}

\\
h3.Workaround

*Follow our [Increasing JIRA Memory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Increasing+JIRA+Memory] guide to increase the memory available to JIRA, restart JIRA and try to import/export the backup again.* If this doesn't work, please follow the instructions below:

\\
*For importing:*
It is possible to remove the affected lines from the backup with:
# Run:
{code}grep -En  "data tableName=" activeobjects.xml | grep -A1 "MAILITEMCHUNK" | cut -d":" -f1{code}
This will return two numbers.
# use {{vim}} to open the activeobjects.xml and run:
{code}
:num1,num2s;<string>.*</string>;<string></string>;g
{code}
Where num1 and num2 are the numbers returned in the first step. e.g.:
{code}:45635,58649s;<string>.*</string>;<string></string>;g{code}
# save and exit vim;
# zip the backup again and import.

This will return the body of the emails that are stored.

\\
*To export:*
# Turn off the Email Puller so that no new mail will be added to the database
#* JIRA Administration > System > Global Mail Settings
# Wait at least 5 minutes so that the mail processor is able to process mail that is already in the database
# Stop JIRA;
# Run the following update in the database to delete the mail items:
#* Optional: backup this table using your database's native tools before running the update
{code:SQL}
UPDATE "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK" SET "MIME_MSG_CHUNK" = NULL;
{code}
# Restart JIRA;
# Export the data again.
# Turn the Email Puller back on
fields.summary: XML backup or restore of AO tables fails to complete due to Jira running out of heap space

fields.description:
Hello,

if we insert a link to a confluence-page in a jira-Ticket we get an error, if the title of the confluence-site contains a colon. The search for a confluence-page replaces the colon with the encoded characters %3A.
Clicking the button for inserting the link results in the error message, that the confluence-site can't be found.
If we replace the encode characters %3A by the colon manually, the inserting is sucessful.

You can see the Workflow in the attached file.
I hope you can understand the workflow, because we have German as locale.

Kind regards
Sebastian Heybach
fields.summary: Inserting a link to a Confluence-page in jira-Ticket results in error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This occurs on the Dashboard when JIRA has migrated from the old pie chart gadget to the new pie chart dashboard item. If the pie chart gadget was previously displaying a saved filter and the pie chart gadget is upgraded, when the dashboard item is edited the filter's name will be lost.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the 'Manage add-ons' screen, within the 'Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin', disable the 'piechart-dashboard-item'
# Create a new saved filter
# Create a new pie chart gadget on a dashboard, and make that pie chart gadget display the saved filter
# Re-enable the 'piechart-dashboard-item' plugin to upgrade to the new pie chart dashboard item
# Refresh the dashboard to display the updated gadget
# Edit the pie chart dashboard item, and notice that the filter name has changed to 'filter-12345' under 'Project or Saved Filter'

h3. Expected Results
The filter's name should be displayed instead of 'filter-12345'.

h3. Actual Results
'filter-12345' is displayed under 'Project or Saved Filter' in the pie chart dashboard item's edit screen

h3.Workaround
The filter can be re-selected from the edit screen, which will restore it. Selecting 'Cancel' from the edit screen will re-display the pie chart, where the filter name can be noted down from the gadget title. Then select 'Edit' on the dashboard item again, and enter the filter's name.

Alternatively, the 'piechart-dashboard-item' can be disabled via the 'Manage add-ons' screen within the 'Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin', which will downgrade the pie chart dashboard item to the old version.
fields.summary: Editing pie chart gadget causes filter name to disappear

fields.description:
h3. Summary
I recently updated the JIRA 7 documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+PostgreSQL) to update the database collation type as using the previously recommended settings would cause the following error in the logs:
{code}    ****************************************************************************************************
    You are using an unsupported postgres72 collation: en_US.UTF-8. This may cause some functionality to not work.
    Please use POSIX.UTF-8 or C.UTF-8 or C or POSIX as the collation instead.
    ****************************************************************************************************{code}

Our supported platform guide:https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Supported+platforms, states that you should run postgres with the corresponding driver, which must be downloaded by the user.  JIRA is bundled with the 9.0 version of the driver by default, which appears to work correctly.  However if this is the case then should the supported platforms be updated to remove this requirement or should the postsql installation guide be updated to include the instructions for installing the driver as it is in https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/connecting-jira-to-postgresql-185729433.html#ConnectingJIRAtoPostgreSQL-2.CopythePostgreSQLJDBCdrivertoyourapplicationserver(JIRAWARonly)

h3. Expected Results

The supported platforms should be updated to remove the driver requirement
*or*
The installation documentation should be updated to include the download and installation of the driver
fields.summary: JIRA 7 PostgreSQL instructions need updating

h5. Problem Definition
When importing issues from Redmine, code highlighting is lost, as the {{<pre><code>}} tags are not recognized by JIRA.
For more reference on Redmine text formatting, see [here|http://www.redmine.org/projects/redmine/wiki/RedmineTextFormatting#Code-highlighting].

h5. Suggested solution
Translate code highlighting from Redmine to JIRA wiki markup when performing import.
fields.summary: Redmine import should recognize <pre> and <code> tags

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the same setup as JRA-45608 I get IE11 to crash in the dropdown for versions.

I attach a picture of the error message and how it looks in IE 10 at our site.

h3. Environment
This Applies to version 6.4.12 (our site) and 7.0 (this site)  - I cannot use the Affected Version/s field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project.
# Create 20 versions and associated with the project.
# Released 20 versions in the project.
# Navigate to any screen.
# Click 'Create' button near top of screen.
# Select 'new created project' from project list.
# Click arrow to right of Fix Version/s or Affects Version/s

 !ErrorCapture.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

It should be working using IE 11.

h3. Actual Results

After doing this, we get a message that says "A problem with this webpage caused Internet Explorer to close and reopen the tab.". Then, we are redirected back to the screen when we were on before trying to create the issue.

h3.Workaround
Refer to JRA-45608
fields.summary: Fix Version/s menu crashes IE 11

  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently we state that jTDS 1.2.4 is supported for JIRA: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html]. However, version 1.3.1 of the driver is available for a while and brings a good number of performance improvements and bug fixes.

h4. Suggestion
Run the tests with jTDS 1.3.1 and suggest that on the supported platforms page instead

Reference:
- http://jtds.sourceforge.net/
fields.summary: Test with jTDS 1.3.1

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45900].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Currently everytime user create a same project type in JIRA 7, the project will be using basic workflow scheme.

*Suggested Solution*

User would like JIRA to have option during project creation, when user select similar project type all of them using a specific workflow scheme for that specific project type. For example if user select "Scrum software development", the project should use a specific workflow scheme assigned to this type of project.

*Workaround*

User can replicate this by using the "Create with shared configuration".
fields.summary: Assign specific workflow scheme for specific project type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The rounding of percentages on a PIE chart is not being calculated properly in the PIE chart gadget.

In my test instance I have created 300 issues, which were divided into to groups"

* 146 issues or 48.667%
* 154 issues or 51.333%

On the PIE chart the percentages are shown as 48 and 51 percent. (see screenshot)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Dashboard with piechart.
# Insert data 
# Check percentages

h3. Expected Results

Rounding should be done properly to achieve 100%

h3. Actual Results

Percentages add up to 99%

 
h3. Notes
Currently not aware of a fix or workaround
fields.summary: Percentage on PIE Chart does not add up to 100%

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45884].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce.
# Create a Workflow with new statuses.
# Assign it to a Workflow Scheme that Include JIRA Default Workflow and the new workflow.
# Assign the Issue types for the workflow, for example the New Workflow is for "New Feature" issue type.
# Create a new issue type scheme that exclude "New Feature" issue types.
# Create a new project with the newly created Issue Type Scheme and Workflow Scheme.
# Create several issues.
# Go to issue navigator and search for that specific project.
# Click on the Status button. 

h3. Desired Results:
Only status that is from JIRA Default Workflow will be listed.

h3. Current Results:
New statuses from the New Workflow will be included as well.

h3. Notes:
- It looks like the issue navigator will still be showing any status that is mentioned on the Workflows that is specified on the Workflow Scheme, even though it is not being used.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator to only shows the Status used by the project
Ability to copy and paste a list of versions to an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If we select *Add field* from a dropdown in *Assigned to Me* gadget, 400 HTTP error occurred.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard
# Add *Assigned to Me* gadget to the dashboard
# Assign any issue to yourself
# Click option dropdown on any issue in the gadget
# Select *Add field* from the dropdown

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should show 'Custom fields' page.

h3. Actual Results
400 HTTP error occurs and JIRA shows blank page.
 
h3. Notes
When this problem occurred, the URL which JIRA tried to access is like a following
{noformat}
http://192.168.33.20:8080/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa&returnUrl=http%3A%2F%2F192.168.33.20...
{noformat}

but it seems weird.
The symbol before the GET parameters should not be {{&}} but {{?}} like a following.
{noformat}
http://192.168.33.20:8080/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa?returnUrl=http%3A%2F%2F192.168.33.20...
{noformat}
fields.summary: If we select 'Add field' from a dropdown in 'Assigned to Me' gadget, 400 HTTP error occurred

fields.description:
h3. Summary
CSV importer doesn't import *Select List (cascading)* field data correctly.
This problem happens only when we use {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}} on the top page.
This problem never happens when we import CSV with using {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page.

h3. Environment
* JIM 7.1.25

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Add *Select List (cascading)* custom field and set their options
# Associate the custom field to the project you created on step1
# Import CSV (See example file) from {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}}

h3. Expected Results
The CSV data should be imported to JIRA correctly.

h3. Actual Results
*Select List (cascading)* custom field data (especially the child option) wasn't imported. (See following screenshot)
!cascading.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Use {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page instead.
fields.summary: CSV importer doesn't import 'Select List (cascading)' field data correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the issue search screen, the "Attach Screenshot" button is displayed by going on the issue's "More" button. When viewing the issue directly, the "Attach Screenshot" button is not displayed.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)

Tested on JIRA 7.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Installed a fresh environment
# Created a test project and an issue
# Go to {{Issues > Search for Issues}}
# On the issue, click {{More}}. The button "Attach Screenshot" is displayed.
# Now, access the ticket directly, and hit the {{More}} button. The button "Attach Screenshot" is missing.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA would behave the same way on both screens - either showing the button on both sides or none.

h3. Actual Results

The result differs based on the screen. In the search, the button is displayed. In the issue, the button is missing.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behaviour of the "Attach Screenshot" button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45874].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
[This documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-735941325.html] states that in JIRA Cloud, the HipChat integration is under:
*System > Mail > HipChat integration*

Actually, it's under:
*Applications > Integrations > HipChat Integration*

This was likely changed in one of the latest releases.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update documentation accordingly.
fields.summary: Fix documentation for integration JIRA/HipChat

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When browsing the JIRA (pre-7) documentation, you are faced with drop-down pickers to choose the version number of the software you are looking for.  If you select another version, you are taken to the main menu for the version and have to find the page you require again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a CAC page https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-global-permissions-185729559.html
# Select a different version number from the drop-down e.g. JIRA 6.3

h3. Expected Results
You should be re-directed to the same page, but a different version. 
h3. Actual Results
You are taken to the main menu and need to re-navigate to the information you require.
fields.summary: CAC drop down version navigation takes you to the starting page
JIRA Software Cloud missing estimation documentation
Missing page in documentation (CAC). Link leads to create new page for permissions overview

fields.description:
As we are using JIRA with SSO (single sign-on) in our company, the application URLs of all application links need to be different than the display URLs. E.g. here's how the application link from JIRA to Confluence is configured:

- *Application URL:* http://confluence.xyz.com:8090
- *Display URL:* http://confluence.xyz.com

This works perfectly when users try to link JIRA issues to Confluence pages by using the full page URL (e.g. http://confluence.xyz.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=123), but as soon as they try to create the link by using the tiny URL of the page (e.g. http://confluence.xyz.com/x/xyz) the following error will be displayed:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45840].
{panel}
*Original description:*

When creating a Project using the {{Create with shared configuration}} button on the Create Project screen, it could give the user the impression that the projects would have an ongoing connection of some kind, such as with JRA-7020.

However, the feature currently just "clones" the existing configuration. Because of this, it would be nice if the wording changed.

The button could change from {{Create with shared configuration}} to {{Clone Existing Project Configuration}} (similar to cloning plans/deployments in Bamboo).

In addition, the title of the next screen "Create with shared configuration" would read "Clone with existing project configuration".

In addition, the description of the next screen "Select the existing project that you'd like to share configurations with." would read "Select the existing project that you'd like to clone the configuration of."

In addition, the warning message "When a configuration is shared with several projects, it means that any changes made to the configuration will affect all the projects." on the next page could say "While project configuration schemes are shared between projects, it means that any changes made to the configuration will affect all the projects."

If this feature ever becomes similar to JRA-7020, this could be rolled back.

 

*Update*

Since the word "Clone" implies doing something that the functionality does not really provide, the suggestion to call it "Shared Schemes" or "Use existing Schemes" instead of "Shared configuration" makes it much clear to understand what exactly will be done.
fields.summary: Change wording of "Shared Configuration" feature

h3. Summary
Unable to expand collapsed comments as anonymous user

h3. Environment

Not environment specific

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1.  add enough comments to trigger comment collapsing
2.  Allow anonymous access to the project
3.  navigate to an issue that has numerous comments and is collapsed and attempt to expand the comments. 

h3. Expected Results
Comments expand

h3. Actual Results
Comments do not expand.  Comment shows as 'loading' and never actually loads.

The below exception is thrown in the HAR file:
{noformat}
:path /browse/MODULES-1736?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel&showAll=true&_=1445280562631
{noformat}

Fails with 404 error


h3. Workaround
Turn off comment collapsing
[Disable comment collapse|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Disable+comment+auto+collapse+in+JIRA]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45836].
{panel}
h3. Summary

The @mention feature of JIRA is failing to find some users (mostly ones with names starting with the initial letter of the domain) because the javascript responsible for this feature performs a filter over the results of a query via a REST call which is limited to 10 results. The REST call returns users which match the query string (username parameter in the rest call) based on if it exists in EITHER the username, display name, or email address. Because normally the domain matches many users email address, searching for users starting with the initial letter of the domain, will be filtered out. 
e.g: mike@mydomain.com may be filtered out when searching for m if there are many more users with @mydomain.com email address and at least 10 users alphabetically before mike.
h3. Environment

Affected version: 7.0.0-OD-08
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 11 users with the same domain email address. eg: @example.com
 # Name the first 10 users with Letters before e
 # Name the 11th user 'example'
 # Try to mention the user in a comment.

h3. Expected Results

If you use the complete username, or display name, the user should always appear.
h3. Actual Results

Using the complete username or display name, doesn't show the user because the rest api is returning 10 previous users (but not displaying them as options)
h3. Notes

When troubleshooting, take into consideration that you may need to refocus the comment box for the search to be done: JRA-59304
h3. Workaround

*Partial workaround*
Try with a different user value (if you tried with username, try display name, or last name). The last name value works particularly well as it is quite unique.

*Confirmed workaround*
Typing the first few characters of a user's name and hitting the {{TAB}} button will autocomplete and allow for the user to be mentioned (until you refresh the page) _e.g. John = Joh...{{TAB}}_
fields.summary: Some JIRA '@mentions' are not showing all users due JavaScript and REST APIs filters

  {panel}

h3. Summary
As mentioned at [Change Site Logo|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/change-your-site-logo-and-colors-744721608.html#Changeyoursitelogoandcolors-Changethesitelogo], user should be able to revert the color scheme if they don't like it. Once the logo is changed, clicking *Undo* button does not revert the color scheme.
{quote}
We'll automatically change the colour scheme to match your logo, and if you like it, there's nothing more you need to do. We'll give you the option to undo the colour change with a single click, just in case you're not happy with the result.
{quote}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to _Look and Feel_ configuration
# Change the logo with different background color (othen than blue)
# The color scheme will be changed to match the logo's color
# There will be notification message to offer users to _Undo_ it
#* {{We've updated the color scheme to match your logo. Undo.}} 
# Click on _Undo_ button

h3. Expected Result
The color scheme should be reverted back 

h3. Current Result
The color scheme remains the same

h3.NOTES:
in testing the custom color code applied that is changed when the logo is uploaded cannot be reset to the same value:
exe: if you set Header background color to {{#ff03ee}} and it is reset when the logo is uploaded reseting it to {{#ff03ee}} will not change the color BUT any other color i.e. {{#ff03ed}} or {{#ff03ef}} will allocate the change.

h3.Workaround:
# Note all custom color codes applied manually
#* i.e.{{#ff03ee}}
# Select Reset to default and all jira default colors are applied and logo removed
# Upload the Custom Site Logo While Default colors are set
# Do not select the undo option when automatic color change is applied
# Manually re-apply custom color values to the desired values you noted initially
fields.summary: Unable to revert the color scheme after changing logo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45826].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, upgrading JIRA using installer will perform the following:
# Creating backup of the installation directory
# Deleting the installation directory
# Extracting the installer, and so on

When extracting the installer, it will check the available memory space. If user does not have enough space, user is required to cancel the upgrading process half way. By doing so, the next time user tries to upgrade, he will lose the "upgrade" option, and will be presented with new installation instead, since the installation directory has been deleted during the initial attempt.

h5. Suggested Solution
JIRA should check the memory space available before proceeding with the upgrading process (deleting the installation directory, and so on)
fields.summary: JIRA installer should check memory space available before proceeding with upgrading steps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45820].
  {panel}

After a recent issue with upgrading JIRA (where older Java version was not supported anymore), I was surprised that the JIRA installer did not check for prerequisites during installation (I am talking about Windows installer upgrading an existing installation). It's my fault completely for failing to read the supported platforms page at all, but nevertheless it would still be nice to prevent people from shooting themselves in the foot (and possibly reducing number of support requests in the long run).

There are at least two places I can think of where a "fail fast" approach would be of more help:

1. JIRA Installer should check which Java version is installed and fail if it is not supported.
2. Batch scripts for the JIRA service installation should *not* try to guess the JIRA path, but instead fail immediately if {{JRE_HOME}} and {{JAVA_HOME}} are not defined. Otherwise it's easy to get the incorrect Java instance running for the Tomcat service, even though there are no warnings during installation. Right now the script checks {{JRE_HOME}}, then {{JAVA_HOME}} and then defaults to a bundled JRE installation (and the resulting folder looks "funny" like described [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/31662205/answers/31663637]).

Finally, docs on configuring {{JAVA_HOME}} should be clarified to remove ambiguities. All over the Atlassian site, it's suggested to define {{JAVA_HOME}} to point to Java *JRE* folder. On the other hand, if you install Bamboo, it requires that {{JAVA_HOME}} is pointing to Java *JDK*. Even the batch script which installs JIRA as a service first checks if {{JRE_HOME}} is defined, instead of {{JAVA_HOME}}.

It seems a correct setup would be:
- {{JAVA_HOME}} - points to JDK (needed for Bamboo, and not needed at all if you are only running JIRA),
- {{JRE_HOME}} - points to JRE (also including the bundled JRE)
- service scripts checks if they are indeed pointing to correct folders and fails as soon as one of these variables is configured incorrectly.
fields.summary: JIRA setup should perform more "sanity checks" before installing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing a comment does not generate any change history for the issue. (Also verified from the database {{changegroup}} and {{changeitem}} tables) 
All of the issue tabs (All, History) does not show the Comment Edited action.
(i) Note: Comment Edited notifications are still being fired correctly. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
{panel}
User A has Edit Comment permission.
User B has Comment permission.
{panel}
# User B creates a comment on ticket
# User A edits user B's comment
# User B receives email that user A edited user B's comment

h3. Expected Results
User B views 'All' history tab within ticket and sees record of user A editing their comment, along with the changes made.

h3. Actual Results
User B views 'All' history tab within ticket and sees no record of user A editing their comment.
In fact, it shows that User B's comment is now the edited comment. 
See [^CommentEditNotShown.png]
 
h3. Notes
Tested on 6.3.15 and also managed to reproduce the same problem.
You don't really need the mail server set up, just edit the comment and the problem is reproduced. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: History of comment edits are not shown

h3. Summary

Due date accepts incompatible dates to the configured Date/Time format if manually edited.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)

Tested on JIRA 6.4.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a ticket with the default date format
# Fill the Due Date with the date picker
# Change the Day/Month/Year format to "dd/MMM/yyyy"
# Go back to the issue and edit the Date in the Due Date field to something like: 01/01/20016

h3. Expected Results

JIRA would show a message like when an invalid type of date is included in a field (this already happens when you try to include a month as number instead of name): You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy", eg. "16/Oct/15". 

h3. Actual Results

JIRA allows the change to be made. This will make filters stop searching for that issue if based on the due date field, since the date is messed up.

h3.Workaround

Use the default model or just restrict the year back to "yy" in the Day/Month/Year format field.
fields.summary: Invalid Dates are being accepted in the Due Date field
Spelling correction change 'not' to 'note'

Hi Guys,
While updating The Scheduler Plugin to JIRA 7.0 i have found an error in com.atlassian.scheduler.status.JobDetail.getNext RunTime(). Time returned by this function is not actually the time of next running. Sometimes it does work correct however in case of triggers like 0 0/1 * ? * * is not. TheScheduler plugin have to using this function to make users sure that trigger is working well and the tasks will be running on time. 

What more JIRA displays a wrong time of next run too. At Admin-> system-> Scheduler Details. (like in attached screen)

Cheers, Jacek

*Issue Summary*
A user attaching an image which has transparency in it as a thumnail in JIRA gets a broken image.

This appears correctly however if the image is clicked on for preview.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create an issue.
* Add an attachment made up of an image file that has some transparency.
* Attach it in a comment as a thumbnail {code}!example.PNG|thumbnail!{code}

*Expected Result*
Image shows up like every other image added as a thumbnail.

*Actual Result*
Image is broken and would only display it's content correctly when a user clicks on it to preview.

*Suggestion Summary*
A user based on his organization's requirement might need to show more than the allowed 50 results on a dashboard's filter gadget.

However due to the current restriction of only 50, the organization would not be able to use any gadget satisfactorily to match their requirements.

Can a feature be added(be it dark feature) that allows users to increase this limit, should a user proceed to use it however, a warning can be shown informing them about possible  performance issues and they can proceed with using it agreeing that they are aware of the risks involved.

Users are restricted to 50 and this cannot be increased any where.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Setting the *Indexing Language* as Czech, would make your issue navigator not return search results correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *General Configuration*
# Under *Internationalization*, change the *Indexing Language* to Czech.
# Create Issues with Czech words in the summary
Example: *Nové přihlášení* or *Pravé sloupce* 
# Now go to the issue navigator and either search for *Nové* or *Pravé*

h3. Expected Results
The issue *Nové přihlášení* should be displayed, along with all other issues that contain *Nové* and other words stemming from *Nové like "nová, nový

h3. Actual Results
The issue navigator would display: *No issues were found to match your search* .
 
h3. Notes
Only searching the exact phrase like *Nové přihlášení* will return the that particular issue in the issue navigator.

h3.Workaround
Change the *Indexing language* to *English - Moderate Stemming*. You will be able to search Czech words, however, you will not benefit from word stemming feature.
fields.summary: Czech Indexing language handicaps your searching ability in the issue navigator

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45796].
  {panel}

Example:

I often use the screenshot tool built into my OS, which generates files with names like +Screenshot from 2015-10-15 13:37:04.png+. When I try to insert one into a JIRA ticket, I'm told that the filename contains invalid characters, and that I need to

# Remove the attachment from the Issue.
# Open a separate piece of software on my system.
# Rename the image.
# Upload the same file to your server a second time.

This is a pretty ridiculous example of user-hostility. Your server successfully receives a file, has all the resources it needs to move forward, and does the opposite instead. Why not just strip or replace the characters you don't want to use on your end, or ask the user to input a different name to use?
fields.summary: Handling of invalid characters in attachment filenames too intolerant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45794].
{panel}
If a background thread holds a database connection for more than five minutes, the ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor gets confused with a "-2" low-water mark and it dumps seemingly-incorrect warnings in the logs.

For example, when testing a background thread that was using a connection for five minutes, the ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor logged the following in relation to an Atlassian-internal OFBIZ call. The stack trace shows that it corresponds to a connection closed within GenericDAO#select (triggered by a IssueManager#getIssueObject):
{code:java}
2015-10-15 13:39:41,827 dataplane-CHCT-3 WARN      [c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: replaced => count=-1; marks=[-2-0]; pool=1/20
{code}
Note the low water mark of "-2".

The ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor creates a CountHolder inner class which causes the ThreadLocal to self-destruct after five minutes. Subsequent to that self-destruction, the next connection to be returned to the pool (which is probably the connection for which the taken() method was just previously called) calls the replaced() method, which does not check to see if the low water mark is below zero, and which causes this warning to be logged.

I suppose that the answer could easily be "we don't want your thread to hold database connections for more than 5 minutes", but that notwithstanding, it looks like ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor is not working quite as intended in this scenario.

 

*Workaround*

Please configure package level logging for com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz to ERROR.
See the attached screenshot for the details.

as described [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Logging+and+profiling]
fields.summary: Atlassian-jira.log shows 'Dangerous use of multiple connection' warnings due to a process holding a database connection for longer than 5 minutes

  {panel}

i haven't tried Jira 7 yet, but in Jira 6.4.12 the JDBC driver version is postgresql-9.0-801.jdbc4.jar and this is really old.

Even Confluence has been shipping JDBC postgresql-9.4-1202-jdbc41.jar.

We are using PostgreSQL 9.4 right now, so pushing JIRA's bundled JDBC to as close to 9.4 driver would be ideal.

I am not sure why JIRA is still behind Confluence.

As a matter of fact, why is Confluence's bundling it under CONF_INSTALL/confluence/WEB-INF/lib while Jira is bundling JDBC under JIRA_INSTALL/lib/

Thanks.
fields.summary: Update JIRA PostgreSQL JDBC driver

h3. Notes
This problem seems to originate from:
{code:java|title=HealthStatusPersistenceServiceImpl.java:160 | borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
    List<HealthCheckStatus> getFailedStatuses()
    {
        Query query = Query.select().where("IS_HEALTHY = false AND IS_RESOLVED = false").order("SEVERITY ASC");
        HealthCheckStatusAO[] healthCheckStatuseAOs = ao.find(HealthCheckStatusAO.class, query);
        return transform(asList(healthCheckStatuseAOs), aoToApiConverter);
    }
{code}
So it seems we are querying for "IS_HEALTHY = false" whereas not every DBMS has a boolean type.

h3.Workaround
# Navigate to *Administration » Add-ons » Manage Add-ons*;
# Select *All add-ons* under the filter options and search for "Health";
# Uninstall both add-ons:
#* Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Healthcheck Plugin
#* Support Healthcheck Plugin
# And restart JIRA so it will use the bundled version.

  {panel}

Dear Atlassian team,

In Jira, we can create role, group...
However, it should be nice to create schema of role for project.
Why? In current JIRA, each time you create new role, they appear in project role. Some role have almost same name than other role, and they aren't used by this project.
If we can choose a schema of role we can choose the role used by project only and hide unused roles (that allow to see needed role only and we aren't flooded by not needed role).
Thanks in advance for your help.
Sorry if suggestion already exist but i don't see it.

Regards,
Mickael

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Links with URLs containing certain non-alphanumeric characters fail to save 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click open any issue
# Click on *More* and then *Link*
# Select *Web Link*
Example:  
{code}
http://company/projects/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fprojectweb%2FShared%20Documents%2FFF%20ER&FolderCTID=0E128&View= {A6-4B6B-44A79F36}
{code}
# Put a link with non-alphanumeric characters
# Save it by clicking on *Link*

h3. Expected Results
The Link should be saved and viewable on the issue like any other web link.

h3. Actual Results
Doesn't save. We get the following error on the UI
{noformat}
Invalid 'URL'. Make sure you include the full URL (e.g. http://www.google.com).
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Go to Google Shortner at https://goo.gl/
# Paste the URL
# Google will generate a *short url* for your URL which you will be able to link in JIRA.
# Google will also be change your *long URL* to characters, which can also be saved onto JIRA
fields.summary: Links with URLs containing certain non-alphanumeric characters fail to save

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45788].
  {panel}

h3.Summary
There seems to be a weird bug where users can choose workflow scheme for their project. They can choose a scheme named *default* (which is *Default Workflow Scheme*) from the drop down but when they go to workflow scheme the *Default Workflow Scheme* is not listed there.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Navigate to {{https://<ATLASSIAN_INSTANCE_NAME>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PROJECT_KEY>/workflows}}.
# Select *default* as the scheme.
# You will notice that the workflow scheme is named *Default Workflow Scheme*.
# If you go to the *Workflow Scheme* page however, you will not find it any where on the list.

h3.Expected Result
*Default Workflow Scheme* should be seen in the *Workflow Scheme*.

h3.Current Result
*Default Workflow Scheme* is not listed in the *Workflow Scheme*.
fields.summary: 'Default Workflow Scheme' missing from Workflow Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45787].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
If a user attempt to edit the context of a custom field in IE, the due to the size specified in the Select field for both project and issue type, the slider is unavailable to the user.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Go to the configure page of a custom field.
# Select the Edit Configuration.
# In the Select field sections of the page, the slider is unavailable so users would need to press the up and down arrow to sort through the options available to them.

*Cause*
The available select option size set is too small for the slider to appear.
{code}<select name="issuetypes" size="5" multiple "">.......</select>{code}
- Increasing the size above to about 10 would make the slider appear if the select option is long enough.

*Expected Result*
User would be able to use the slider to navigate faster as seen in Chrome and Firefox browsers.

*Actual Result*
Slider is not available hence user would need to press the arrow buttons till they get to the option they want to select.

*Workaround*
(i) The below is meant for JIRA 6.4.X and below and has not been tested with JIRA 7.X
# Create a CSS file with the following code:{code}select {	
	height:180px;
}{code}
# Add the file to {{JIRA Installation > atlassian-jira > includes}} folder.
# Open JIRA and go to Announcement Banner page.
#* Go to {{Admin > System > Announcement Banner}} page.
# In the field available add the following {code}<LINK href="http://<jiraserver>/includes/<mystyle.css>" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">{code}
# The above would increase the field size and should your option be more than the height specified, the slider would appear.
fields.summary: Increase the Size of Select field in Context page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA's REST API currently provides response only in JSON format. Users migrating from JIRA's SOAP and XML-RPC remote APIs may also miss this particularly.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide XML formats for REST API outputs as well, for additional convenience.
fields.summary: Extend REST API to support XML response

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45785].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Based on the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/checking-the-progress-of-a-version-720416820.html#Checkingtheprogressofaversion-UnderstandingtheReleasepage], its stated:
{quote}
1. Only one of these will be displayed — the most recent one. 
2. If multiple items have the same timestamp, the one that will be displayed is determined by this priority: *pull requests > reviews > commits > branches.*
{quote}

If follow this steps:
# Create a review on the issue A.
# Add a commit message for issue A after 5 minutes.
# It will shows *reviews* instead of *commits* on the *Development* column from the Release progress page. 

It seems JIRA doesn't respect the first condition if *reviews* and *commits* are having different timestamp. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It should follow the first condition as mentioned in the documentation. If not, please update the documentation to the latest use case to avoid any further confusion in the future.
fields.summary: Release project development progress use case

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45783].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Currently admin is not able to reorder the custom fields while moving an issue from 1 project to another.

*Suggested Solution*

User would like to have function to reorder the custom fields according to their need while moving an issue from 1 project to another.

*Workaround*

Create separate screens for issue types for both projects. For example if you have Project A & Project B and you are trying to move Issue 1 from Project A to Project B. After moving the issue, since you have separate issue type screen scheme for Project B, you can configure the screen manually.
fields.summary: Reorder Custom Field when moving an Issue from 1 Project to another

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45781].
  {panel}

Display clearer message when Issue Search is not displaying all messages

Currently, the JIRA Issue search will display a message on the final page of results stating that no more issues will be displayed as the number of issues returned are limited, however this can be easy to miss - especially after looking over so many results.

In addition, itt is not possible to reach the last page directly (you have to click on the icon-button "->" to go from page to page) so it is not possible to immediately view that the result is truncated. 

A message near the number of issues found, on the first page (or all pages) of results would be clearer.
fields.summary: Display clearer message when Issue Search is not displaying all messages

h3. Environment

No Look & Feel changes were made, nor were advanced settings for dates configured - everything is left as the default.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upon upgrading from 5.x (tested with 5.2.11) to 6.x (tested with 6.4.8) the JIRA custom avatars are broken. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up JIRA 5.x
# Upload custom avatars
# Now set up a clean 6.x JIRA
# Stop JIRA 6.x and point it to the home directory of 5.x in order to upgrade the data

h3. Expected Results
JIRA would be upgraded and avatars would work normally.

h3. Actual Results
After the upgrade, notice that all the custom avatars are broken.

 
h3. More details
# In JIRA earlier to 6.x, uploaded avatar has this naming convention:
*10200\_medium\_photo.jpg*, *10200\_photo.jpg*, *10200\_small\_photo.jpg*
# In JIRA 6.x, uploaded avatar has this naming convention:
*10200\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_medium\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_small\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_xlarge\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_xsmall\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_xxlarge\@2x\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_xxlarge\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_xxxlarge\_photojrvtg.jpg*, *10200\_xxxlarge\@2x\_photojrvtg.jpg*
# Other than the amount of files it generates, it puts *jrvtg* tag on every files 
# the [upgrade task|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/6.4.1/com/atlassian/jira/upgrade/tasks/UpgradeTask_Build6209.html] is supposed to rename the avatar filenames at the time of upgrade, but this upgrade task did not run in my testing.




*This issue is not reproducible in JIRA 7.*
fields.summary: Upgrading from 5.x to 6.x breaks custom avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45771].
  {panel}

My apologies if this is a duplicate.  I have searched for this topic, but have not found a match.

Viewing an avatar is tied to the Browse Users global permission.  In our instance, this permission is granted to authenticated users within a certain group.  However, some Kanban boards are viewable to anonymous users.  This leads to the issue.

Steps to reproduce:
* Ensure only authenticated users within certain groups have Browse Users permissionj
* Enable anonymous view only access to a Kanban board
* View a Kanban board without logging in
** the avatars displayed will be the system defaults.  
* Authenticate and view the same board
** the default avatars are still displayed.
* Logout
* Clear the browser cache
* Login (before viewing the board as an anonymous user)
* View the board
** The proper custom avatars will be displayed

It looks like the default avatars are being cached as the named avatars.  Subsequent requests are getting the avatars from the browser cache, even though there is a real avatar now available as an authenticated user.
fields.summary: Custom avatars not displaying after viewing user as unauthenticated user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45767].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently by default JIRA doesn't allow any two factor authentication.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we could integrate JIRA with Radius server which will allow two factor authentication to be setup with ease 

h3. Customer justification
{panel}
We want to open up JIRA outside of the network for external consultants, but due to strict policies we have to have two-factor authentication in place.
We used Duo Security for a while. They had made a plugin for JIRA that made this possible. If you tried to log on to JIRA outside of our network, Duo's system kicked in and asked for authentication via sms / mobile app. Upon succesfull authentication you were then routed into JIRA. 
Unfortunetly they havent kept the plugin up to date, so it stopped working with newer versions of JIRA.
All of our internal users have access to JIRA functions via their Active Directory user (be it jira-users or customers for our JSD), and with a Radius server in between to handle the authentication of the users we could use Duo Integration with Radius to get the two-factor solution in place using their AD users.
{panel}
fields.summary: integrate JIRA with Radius server
Ability to Remove Custom Field from Application/Add-ons if it is not Licensed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45765].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
A user may decide to filter issues based on the project lead so they can monitor the issues that belong to the said project.

Unfortunately this is currently impossible.

*Expected Result*
User can search using the project lead field

*Actual Result*
Feature is missing in JIRA and users cannot filter result based on the project lead field.
fields.summary: Allow Search for Project Lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Redundant nodes from a restored Datacenter are listed under the Cluster Nodes section on the System Info page. The problem would happen if: 
# after an XML System restore.
# rename from one node to another.
# node was removed completely.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a data center with cluster nodes named tnode1, tnode2 for instance
# Restore an XML backup from another data center where nodes are named as node1, node2

h3. Expected Results
Cluster nodes information in the database is refreshed after the changes on the nodes.

h3. Actual Results
* Cluster nodes section of the System info page show the actual expected nodes, together with the nodes that was removed or changed. All node states appear active, but not alive. See screenshot:
!Selection_020.jpg|thumbnail! 
* After a restart of nodes, the actual nodes come alive, but the redundant nodes still appear active. See screenshot:
 !Selection_021.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
See workaround section in [JRASERVER\-42916: Old node ids should get removed in JIRA Data Center|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42916]
fields.summary: Redundant nodes from a restored Datacenter listed on System Info page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45761].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

After configuring application links, the links are not set immediately on the navigator. It seems like it is intermittently lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Display a status for the links to actually sync so users are sure that the links are available after configuration.

h3. Workaround 

Wait for a few minutes, the links will appear
fields.summary: Application link sync status

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User that belong to jira-administrator group only and assign to JIRA System Administrators global permission is not able to delete issue type.

h3. Environment
* Tested on JIRA6.4.12.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum project.
# Assign an user to jira-administrator group and make sure jira-administrator group have JIRA System Administrators global permission.
# Use the same user from step 2 to delete issue type. Navigate to Administrator > Issues. Click on delete for one of the duplicate issue type that was created by JIRA Agile. Note that the duplicated issue type is caused by a bug from [JRA-43539|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43539].
# There will be no "Delete" button.

h3. Expected Results
User with JIRA System Administrators global permission should be able to delete issue type.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

h3.Workaround
# Add the user into *JIRA Users* [Global Permissions|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions], which by defailt is the {{jira-users}} group.
# Delete the issue type as normal.
fields.summary: System Admin unable to delete issue type due to NullPointerException
Don't exclude Agile boards from Business Projects
Update Tutorials on developer.atlassian.com to JIRA 7
Update REST API latest Documentation for JIRA 7
